parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A little papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblion; a booklet.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From eu and onoma; properly, well-named, i.e. The left; neuter as adverbial, at the left hand.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
